intro: Cousinia haussknechtii, commonly known as the Hausknecht's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woolly, gray-green foliage and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Cousinia haussknechtii is adapted to withstand drought and temperature extremes, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
